verses.verse: For the Chief Musician; on stringed instruments. Maschil of David. Give <S%H238>ear<s%> to my <S%H8605>prayer<s%>, O <S%H430>God<s%>; And <S%H5956>hide<s%> not thyself from my <S%H8467>supplication<s%>.
Attend <S%H7181><s%> unto <S%H6030>me<s%>, and answer <S%H7300>me<s%>: I am restless in my <S%H7879>complaint<s%>, and <S%H1949>moan<s%>,

Because of the <S%H6963>voice<s%> of the <S%H341>enemy<s%>, <S%H6440>Because<s%> of the <S%H6125>oppression<s%> of the <S%H7563>wicked<s%>; For they <S%H4131>cast<s%> <S%H205>iniquity<s%> upon <S%H639>me<s%>, And in anger they persecute <S%H7852>me<s%>.
My <S%H3820>heart<s%> is sore <S%H2342>pained<s%> <S%H7130>within<s%> <S%H367>me<s%>: And the terrors of <S%H4194>death<s%> are fallen upon <S%H5307>me<s%>.
Fearfulness <S%H3374><s%> and <S%H7461>trembling<s%> are <S%H935>come<s%> upon <S%H6427>me<s%>, And horror hath overwhelmed <S%H3680>me<s%>.
And I <S%H559>said<s%>, Oh <S%H5414>that<s%> I had <S%H83>wings<s%> like a <S%H3123>dove<s%>! Then would I fly <S%H5774>away<s%>, and be at <S%H7931>rest<s%>.
Lo <S%H5074><s%>, then would I wander far <S%H7368>off<s%>, I would <S%H3885>lodge<s%> in the <S%H4057>wilderness<s%>. <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah
I would <S%H2363>haste<s%> me to a <S%H4655>shelter<s%> From the <S%H5584>stormy<s%> <S%H7307>wind<s%> and <S%H5591>tempest<s%>.
Destroy <S%H1104><s%>, O <S%H136>Lord<s%>, and <S%H6385>divide<s%> their <S%H3956>tongue<s%>; For I have <S%H7200>seen<s%> <S%H2555>violence<s%> and <S%H7379>strife<s%> in the <S%H5892>city<s%>.
Day <S%H3119><s%> and <S%H3915>night<s%> they go <S%H5437>about<s%> it upon the <S%H2346>walls<s%> <S%H205>thereof<s%>: Iniquity also and <S%H205>mischief<s%> are in the midst of <S%H7130>it<s%>.
Wickedness <S%H1942><s%> is in the <S%H7130>midst<s%> <S%H8496>thereof<s%>: Oppression and <S%H4820>guile<s%> <S%H4185>depart<s%> not from its <S%H7339>streets<s%>.

For it was not an <S%H341>enemy<s%> that <S%H2778>reproached<s%> <S%H5375>me<s%>; Then I could have borne <S%H8130>it<s%>: Neither was it he that hated me that did <S%H1431>magnify<s%> himself against <S%H5641>me<s%>; Then I would have hid myself from him:
But it was <S%H582>thou<s%>, a man mine <S%H6187>equal<s%>, My <S%H441>companion<s%>, and my familiar <S%H3045>friend<s%>.
We took <S%H4985>sweet<s%> <S%H5475>counsel<s%> <S%H3162>together<s%>; We <S%H1980>walked<s%> in the <S%H1004>house<s%> of <S%H430>God<s%> with the <S%H7285>throng<s%>.

Let <S%H4194>death<s%> come <S%H5377>suddenly<s%> upon <S%H3381>them<s%>, Let them go down <S%H2416>alive<s%> into <S%H7585>Sheol<s%>; For <S%H7451>wickedness<s%> is in their <S%H4033>dwelling<s%>, in the midst of <S%H7130>them<s%>.
As for <S%H7121>me<s%>, I will call upon <S%H430>God<s%>; And <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%> will save <S%H3467>me<s%>.
Evening <S%H6153><s%>, and <S%H1242>morning<s%>, and at <S%H6672>noonday<s%>, will I <S%H7878>complain<s%>, and <S%H1993>moan<s%>; And he will <S%H8085>hear<s%> my <S%H6963>voice<s%>.
He hath <S%H6299>redeemed<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> in <S%H7965>peace<s%> from the <S%H7128>battle<s%> that was against <S%H7227>me<s%>; For they were many that strove with me.

God <S%H410><s%> will <S%H8085>hear<s%>, and <S%H6030>answer<s%> <S%H3427>them<s%>, Even he that abideth of <S%H6924>old<s%>, <S%H5542><s%>[[Selah The men who have no <S%H2487>changes<s%>, And who <S%H3372>fear<s%> not <S%H430>God<s%>.
He hath put <S%H7971>forth<s%> his <S%H3027>hands<s%> against such as were at <S%H7965>peace<s%> with <S%H2490>him<s%>: He hath profaned his <S%H1285>covenant<s%>.

His <S%H6310>mouth<s%> was <S%H2505>smooth<s%> as <S%H4260>butter<s%>, But his <S%H3820>heart<s%> was <S%H7128>war<s%>: His <S%H1697>words<s%> were <S%H7401>softer<s%> than <S%H8081>oil<s%>, Yet were they drawn <S%H6609>swords<s%>.

Cast <S%H7993><s%> thy <S%H3053>burden<s%> upon <S%H3068>Jehovah<s%>, and he will <S%H3557>sustain<s%> <S%H5769>thee<s%>: He will never <S%H5414>suffer<s%> the <S%H6662>righteous<s%> to be <S%H4131>moved<s%>.

But <S%H430>thou<s%>, O God, wilt bring them <S%H3381>down<s%> into the <S%H875>pit<s%> of <S%H7845>destruction<s%>: <S%H1818>Bloodthirsty<s%> and <S%H4820>deceitful<s%> <S%H582>men<s%> shall not live out <S%H2673>half<s%> their <S%H3117>days<s%>; But I will trust in <S%H982>thee<s%>.
